questions.question_text: Identify three scenarios where you are not allowed to cancel an invoice.

choices.A: Prepayments were applied to the invoice.
choices.E: The invoice was adjusted by a credit or a debit memo.
choices.B: An accounting entry has been created for the invoice.
choices.D: The invoice is fully or partially paid.

questions.question_text: Which method can you use to route payment approval rules?

discussion.content:
B.
Payment approval rules route the payment approval notifications to approvers in sequential order only. (24D)
Note: Payment approval rules are configured to route payment approval notifications to approvers in sequential order only.

comments.content:
for 21b , it's "Sequential " correct answer is B
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/financials/21b/faipp/disbursements.html

choices.B: Insert the syntax <?if:condition?> before the Supplier field and then enter the closing tag </<?if:condition?>.
choices.A: Insert the syntax <?if:VENDOR_NAME= "ËœCOMPANY A'?> before the Supplier field on the template. Then, enter the <?end if?> tag after the invoices table.
choices.D: Hard code Supplier Name "Company A" in the report template and only invoices for that supplier will be displayed.
choices.C: Insert the syntax <?if:'Company A'?> before the Supplier field and then enter the closing tag </<?if:company A?> after the invoices table.

questions.question_text:
You want to customize the Payables Invoice Register template to only display invoices when the Supplier name is Company A. Supplier name is a group that repeats on every page.
Which is the correct way to customize the template?

discussion.content:
Answer : A.
Remark : correct synthaxe is : <?if:VENDOR_NAME= "COMPANY A"?>. no ~ and text separator is double quote.

questions.question_text: You need to submit a 1099 report; your State format has changed slightly since last year. How should you submit your 1099s for the State in the current year?

discussion.content:
1099 is report for US. How to answer for non US consultant?
answer C means that Oracle modifies this report to be complied to US autoritise
else answer should be D.
Please help!

choices.D: Edit the 1099 template to reflect the changes, and then run and submit the 1099 report.
choices.C: Run and submit your 1099s because it will automatically reflect any changes.
choices.A: Manually enter the 1099s for the State and submit.
choices.B: Generate a 1096 form and submit it instead.

questions.question_text: You need to enter a last-minute invoice during the close process. What is the quickest way to enter and post the invoice to general ledger?

choices.C: Enter and post a manual journal entry directly into the general ledger.
choices.D: Enter the invoice via a spreadsheet and then validate, account, and post the invoice from the spreadsheet.
choices.A: Enter the invoice via a spreadsheet. Then, from the Manage Invoices page, query the invoice, validate it, create accounting, and then open general ledger's Manage Journals page and post the associated invoice journal entry.
choices.B: Enter the invoice in the Create Invoice page, choose the Validate option, and then the Account and Post to Ledger option.

discussion.content: B. Enter the invoice in the Create Invoice page, choose the Validate option, and then the Account and Post to Ledger option.

A. Enter the invoice via a spreadsheet. Then, from the Manage Invoices page, query the invoice, validate it, create accounting, and then open general ledger's Manage Journals page and post the associated invoice journal entry.
Correct Answer is A because "Post to Ledger" action from Invoice workarea doesnot only transfers, but do not post the entry in Journal ledger.,
